summary: Website redesign to match provided screenshots: recreate all homepage sections in the same order, redesign navigation bar to match screenshot style, and use the CupCake SMP logo as primary branding.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- CupCake SMP pixel-art logo with transparent background (cupcakesmp-logo-transparent.dim_200x200.png)
- CupCake SMP square favicon/app icon (cupcakesmp-favicon.dim_64x64.png)
- Dark blurred Minecraft-style hero/banner background image (hero-bg-blur.dim_1920x600.png)

existing_features.title: Redesign the global navigation header to match the uploaded screenshots: left-aligned CupCakeMC logo/brand, centered nav links (Home, Shop, Vote, Discord), and right-aligned cart icon + Login button, using a dark/black translucent bar with a thin pink accent/border and consistent hover states.

Update the Home page to recreate all homepage sections shown in the screenshots, in the same order: (1) hero/intro area with CupCake branding, (2) Server Status card, (3) Vote section card, (4) Discord section card, (5) “Why Choose CupCakeMC?” three-feature grid; ensure layout, typography, and spacing visually match the screenshots.

Make the Home page “Vote for the Server” section match the screenshots by rendering a list of voting-site buttons (name on the left, external-link icon on the right) using the existing website config vote URLs when available, with sensible fallback defaults (e.g., Minecraft-mp.com, TopG.org).

Make the Home page “Join Our Discord” section match the screenshots: centered Discord icon above a pink headline, short descriptive text, and a prominent button that opens the configured Discord invite link in a new tab (with fallback if not configured).

Apply a coherent CupCakeMC visual theme across the site to match the screenshots: dark background, pink accent color, soft glow/border treatments on cards, and a pixel/arcade-like heading style for key titles (e.g., “Vote for the Server”, “Why Choose CupCakeMC?”).

Add and use the CupCake SMP logo provided by the user as the primary branding asset in the header (and as a favicon/app icon where applicable), ensuring the logo has a transparent background variant for clean display on the dark navbar.
Store required generated images in frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend (do not serve generated images via the backend).
